thread.title: SMB blasts Castro-less TNT to reach Philippine Cup Finals
thread.title_full: SMB blasts Castro-less TNT to reach Philippine Cup Finals

author: Jane Bracher
title: SMB blasts Castro-less TNT to reach Philippine Cup Finals
text:
SMB blasts Castro-less TNT to reach Philippine Cup Finals San Miguel's title defense remains alive Published 9:10 PM, February 20, 2017 Updated 9:10 PM, February 20, 2017 FINALS-BOUND. San Miguel is bound for the 2017 PBA Philippine Cup Finals after defeating TNT in Game 7. Photo by Czeasar Dancel/Rappler 
MANILA, Philippines – The San Miguel Beermen's title defense remain alive as they overpowered the Jayson Castro-less TNT KaTropa, 96-83, in Game 7 to reach the 2017 PBA Philippine Cup Finals on Monday, February 20 at the Mall of Asia Arena. 
Castro sat out Game 7 due to a hamstring sprain and TNT trailed by double figures for a huge chunk of the contest. 
San Miguel, the two-time reigning all-Filipino titlist, will face the winner between Ginebra and Star in the other series which will play a Game 7 on Tuesday. – Rappler.com HOW DOES THIS STORY MAKE YOU FEEL? Happy
